intro: Blakea cuatrecasasii, commonly known as the Cuatrecasas's Blakea, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its woody stems, palmate leaves, and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in humid, shaded environments within cloud forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
